channel.title: Data Analytics on Zihan Huang
channel.description: Recent content in Data Analytics on Zihan Huang

item.title: Project XIV: Research Project - St. Christopher's Hospital for Children Process Mapping Project
item.description: Date: April - June 2023 Right after I finished my master’s program, I worked as a research assistant with Dr. Hande Benson and Drexel Solutions Institute. We worked on a data analytics project aiming to help St. Christopher Hospital of Children in Philadelphia assess patient flow, examine opportunities for greater productivity and effectiveness to decrease LWOT (patients that leave without treatment), evaluate strategic opportunities and tools for staff communications about patients’ progress within the hospital system and streamline interrelated processes.

item.title: Project XI: Graduate Datathon 2023 - Supply Chain and Distribution Network Analysis with Under Armour
item.description: Date: February 2023 Graduate ‘Datathon’ is an annual, one-day event from LeBow College of business that partners with companies to solve their business questions through data analytics. The guest company for Datathon 2023 was Under Armour. Their business analytics group from Baltimore presented us with a

item.title: Project VIII: Research Project - The Effect of the Sunshine Act Reported Payments on the Utilization Rates of Interspinous Decompression Devices
item.description: Date: June - September 2022 In summer 2022, I participated in a joint scholar program offered by Drexel University College of Medicine and LeBow College of Business that pairs MSBA students with M.D students for research programs. Advised by Dr. Michael Howley and Dr. Michael Weingarten, I worked with two M.D. students on their research programs. This is the second research project I worked with Anastasia Mityanina, a M.D student.

item.title: Project VII: Research Project - Continued Rise of Dizziness Presentation to U.S. Emergency Room
item.description: Date: June - September 2022 In summer 2022, I participated in a joint scholar program offered by Drexel University College of Medicine and LeBow College of Business that pairs MSBA students with M.D students for research programs. Advised by Dr. Michael Howley and Dr. Michael Weingarten, I worked with two M.D. students on their research programs. This is the first research project I worked with Raz Garabet, a M.D student.
